name: das90a
CitiesVisited: Montreal, Quebec, Canada,Churchill, Manitoba, Canada,Sydney, Australia,London, UK,Tallinn, Estonia,New Delhi, India,Bristol, UK,Toronto, Ontario, Canada,Varanasi, India,Agra, India,Arezzo, Italy,Ferrara, Italy,
ownerdesc: Step onboard into a universe awash with astounding contrasts. In an invented space, between two water worlds... float away.Anchored at the Old Port of Montreal, Bota Bota, spa-sur-l'eau offers passengers the healing benefits of a spa coupled with the natural lulling movements of the St Lawrence River. Surrounded by enchanting decor, with Old Montreal as a magical backdrop, this mysterious and innovative floating spa offers privileged proximity to the river while enjoying the relaxing and energizing merits of the water circuit.Bota Bota is comprised of five decks on which you will find the various spa installations: two saunas with incredible views of the river and the Old Port, a eucalyptus steam bath, outdoor whirlpool baths, cold showers and baths, relaxation areas, restaurant, terraces and garden.Over and above its breathtaking Montreal location, this unique spa offers prolonged well-being to its passengers through massage therapy, body treatments, facial treatments, manicures and pedicures, as well as yoga and meditation.You can also delight your taste buds at the restaurant operated by Auberge sur la Route, with Michelin-starred chef Eric Gonzalez at its helm. Affiliated with the reputed Auberge St-Gabriel, Auberge sur la Route allows passengers to complement their experience with a fresh and simple menu, both original and comforting, for a serene healing of body and mind.
review: Great spa with views over old Montreal - in an old ferry that's been converted. The whole set up is amazing with saunas steam rooms etc on all decks with panoramic views as well as pools on the decks - well worth a visit

name: eatplaylove
CitiesVisited: Montreal, Quebec, Canada,Scottsdale, AZ, USA,Denver, CO, USA,Chula Vista, CA, USA,Encinitas, CA, USA,Fargo, ND, USA,Grand Marais, MN, USA,Havana, Cuba,Marrakech, Morocco,Miami, FL, USA,New York City, NY, USA,Ouarzazate, Morocco,
ownerdesc: Step onboard into a universe awash with astounding contrasts. In an invented space, between two water worlds... float away.Anchored at the Old Port of Montreal, Bota Bota, spa-sur-l'eau offers passengers the healing benefits of a spa coupled with the natural lulling movements of the St Lawrence River. Surrounded by enchanting decor, with Old Montreal as a magical backdrop, this mysterious and innovative floating spa offers privileged proximity to the river while enjoying the relaxing and energizing merits of the water circuit.Bota Bota is comprised of five decks on which you will find the various spa installations: two saunas with incredible views of the river and the Old Port, a eucalyptus steam bath, outdoor whirlpool baths, cold showers and baths, relaxation areas, restaurant, terraces and garden.Over and above its breathtaking Montreal location, this unique spa offers prolonged well-being to its passengers through massage therapy, body treatments, facial treatments, manicures and pedicures, as well as yoga and meditation.You can also delight your taste buds at the restaurant operated by Auberge sur la Route, with Michelin-starred chef Eric Gonzalez at its helm. Affiliated with the reputed Auberge St-Gabriel, Auberge sur la Route allows passengers to complement their experience with a fresh and simple menu, both original and comforting, for a serene healing of body and mind.
review: A little overcrowded, but the facial and massage were excellent aboard this unique sea spa. Perfect for a rainy/snowy day!

review: We have taken this mini-cruise earlier this week as a Groupon deal. The boat uses only electricity and probably the most "green" mini-cruise in the old port. The boat captain/guide was informative and quite knowledgeable about Montreal's history. Even for a Montrealer, this tour is quite pleasant. Definitely worth the deal.

ownerdesc: Founded more than 15 years ago, Ecorecreo can be found in the Old Port of Montreal, the Parc Jean-Drapeau. name: travellinman007

ownerdesc: Get a whole new point of view of Montreal! Take a seat on one of our three ships and ride along the St. Lawrence River! AML Cruises offers a unique sightseeing experience of Montreal's Old Port, St. Helene's Island, the shipping docks, and beyond. Our knowledgable guides will recount the history of Montreal, from the settlers until today, and our friendly personnel will be pleased to serve beverages and snacks. AML Cruises also offers a shuttle service to Parc Jean-Drapeau and Longueuil, longer cruises (Montral-Qubec-Tadoussac), brunch and dinner cruises, and nighttime firework viewing cruises. Take it easy and enjoy Montreal from the water!

ownerdesc: Get a whole new point of view of Montreal! Take a seat on one of our three ships and ride along the St. Lawrence River! AML Cruises offers a unique sightseeing experience of Montreal's Old Port, St. Helene's Island, the shipping docks, and beyond. Our knowledgable guides will recount the history of Montreal, from the settlers until today, and our friendly personnel will be pleased to serve beverages and snacks. AML Cruises also offers a shuttle service to Parc Jean-Drapeau and Longueuil, longer cruises (Montral-Qubec-Tadoussac), brunch and dinner cruises, and nighttime firework viewing cruises. Take it easy and enjoy Montreal from the water!
review: $30 for a 90 minute cruise. if you want to eat, it will cost more. Cruises up the St Lawrence river, however, not much to see there except factories, ports, and shipping crates. Not many seats on the ship. I would not recommend this.

memberDescription:
[u"World Adventurer, Overgrown Child, Believer in Magic, Not-so-world-renown Surfer
In 2011 I left everything to start over. I left a 7 year relationship, a cat, sold my house, put everything I had in storage and rented a car and just started driving nervously believing that I would find that thing that was calling me. It wasn't easy. It took a lot of work, a lot of introspection, I emptied my life and put back into it only things that I actually needed and/or that made me a better person. I left a life of self destruction and chose instead the path to self realization.
There was a net to catch my fall, and I wake up every morning grateful for this beautiful life.
I met the love of my life and now we're embarking on a journey around the world and inviting you along.
Follow our blog for travel tips and inspiration and general tips on how to live a happy and healthy life.
http://wetravelandblog.com
=) "]

memberDescription: [u'My passion is planning trips from A to Z! ']
ownerdesc: Sing, dance, laugh, play, relax and connectThe Piano Rouge will open your horizons to the many colors and emotions of this amazing instrument. The Rouge fire of its passion will be unraveled through the notes of its keyboard from Soul Jazz, Classical to Pop joined by voice, other instruments or solo. The Piano Rouge will time travel from the past to present, from a Speakeasy style to World music discovering a variety of Pianists and ending the night with a Soul Funk DJ with Electronic highlights. The Piano Rouge will create a unique experience awakening all your senses with its cozy lounge atmosphere and its friendly interaction between employees, the music and you! Our Bistro Counter will charm you with its dishes while you discover one of our famous cocktails carefully prepared by a Cocktailogist. So enjoy!
review:
Walking past this bar we were drawn in by the live music. The cover charge was $10 and it was well worth it. There are different groups performing throughout the week. The night we went, Christine Ghawi was performing (jazz, blues) and we loved it! Drinks are reasonably priced for a bar in downtown Montreal and the atmosphere was laid...

ownerdesc: The world's largest and most prestigious comedy event presents gala performances, theatre, club shows and free outdoor performances. Every summer, over 2000 shows, including more than 1500 free performances amuse an ever growing public. You can also buy tickets for comedy shows year round at the Just for Laughs office. Just For Laughs Live has produced a variety of year-round comedy concerts/tours and special events since 1998. We have been privileged to present solo tours with some of the hottest names in comedy, including Jerry Seinfeld, Aziz Ansari, Louis CK, John Pinette, Jeremy Hotz, Jim Gaffigan, Margaret Cho, Danny Bhoy, Sugar Sammy, Tommy Tiernan, Joe Rogan, Ron White, Jeff Foxworthy, Bill Engvall & Larry the Cable Guy, Colin Mochrie and Brad Sherwood, and Jeff Dunham.

memberDescription: [u'I love planning trips and doing a lot of research before hand. I try to look for low season when possible to avoid large crowds and save on costs. Trip Advisor is invaluable to me when it comes to selecting hotels. I travel with "adult" family members.\nThe areas of criteria that are most important to me when looking for accommodation. 1) Safety - I want to feel safe in the neighbourhood and the hotel itself. 2) Cleanliness - Even if it\'s an older hotel, there is no excuse for dirt, grime, mould etc. 3) Friendly & helpful staff - they make such a difference to your travel experience and memories of a place. 4) Sleep Quality - I am a really light sleeper so if others have noted that a property has thin walls or continuous traffic or nightclub noise, I will probably skip it. 5) Convenience of the location to getting around the city. If I can find a top end 3 star at a good price, I\'m willing to forego the amenities of a pricier 4 star. ']

ownerdesc: The world's largest and most prestigious comedy event presents gala performances, theatre, club shows and free outdoor performances. Just For Laughs Live has produced a variety of year-round comedy concerts/tours and special events since 1998. We have been privileged to present solo tours with some of the hottest names in comedy, including Jerry Seinfeld, Aziz Ansari, Louis CK, John Pinette, Jeremy Hotz, Jim Gaffigan, Margaret Cho, Danny Bhoy, Sugar Sammy, Tommy Tiernan, Joe Rogan, Ron White, Jeff Foxworthy, Bill Engvall & Larry the Cable Guy, Colin Mochrie and Brad Sherwood, and Jeff Dunham.
review: We just happened to be in Montreal and were so pleased to chance upon the festival! We saw Lewis Black, Doug Loves Movies and Alonzo Bodden -- all very good in their own unique way. The venues were good, the organization and production solid. Such a treat!

I have traveled to Canada, Mexico, Trinidad and Tobago, Ireland, Wales, Scotland, England, France, Switzerland, Luxemburg, Germany, and Italy. memberDescription: [u'Growing up my family traveled a lot, weekend trips by train, long car trips with camping throughout the USA/Mexico/Canada, and especially the Caribbean and Florida Keys, canoe exploration of the Canadian wilderness, train travel through northern Europe, and current experience in Ireland and Bavaria. Three years as an apprentice to become a Fine Dining Chef, Owner/Operator of a Resort with a Restaurant in the Ely Minnesota area, one of only two restaurants in Minnesota that was recommended in the AAA travel guide for Minnesota as having "exceptional" food. When I travel I have no specific agenda, other than to experience the locations. I appreciate fine food and customer service. I dislike pretentious presentations. I really enjoy food that is honest, i.e. has great flavor married with the ingredients. I use the taste of the coffee as an indicator of the owner\'s understanding of the food experience. ']

ownerdesc: Quartier des Spectacles has been Montreal's cultural heart for more than a century. Today, the entertainment district boasts North America's most concentrated and diverse group of cultural venues, making Montreal one of the world's great cultural metropolises. As an exceptional creative space open to artistic diversity, it is the year-round host to countless festivals and events, many of which include free outdoor shows and activities.****Depuis plus de 100 ans, le Quartier des spectacles constitue le coeur culturel de Montreal.Il offre aujourd'hui la plus grande concentration et diversite de lieux de diffusion culturelle en Amerique du Nord, ce qui fait de Montreal une metropole culturelle incontournable dans le monde. Lieu de creation exceptionnel ouvert a la diversite artistique et au metissage culturel, il est anime toute l'annee par un grand nombre de festivals et d'evenements, qui comportent une importante programmation exterieure gratuite.

review: During our recent stay in Montreal we dined at Bonaparte on two occasions - once on Thursday and again on Saturday. Activitiy: Montreal Canadiens Hall of Fame, Montreal
ownerdesc: Chronicling the teams rich history since its founding in 1909, the Montreal Canadiens Hall of Fame is a one-of-a-kind shrine celebrating the most storied team in hockey. It features nearly 10,000 square feet of rare, never-before-seen artifacts, as well as interactive content on a club that has built an unparalleled following of fans across the province, the country and the sport for over 100 years. A visit to the Hall can also be complemented by a guided tour of the Bell Centre.
review: Canadians love their sports. I stopped in here to get out of the het of Summer in Montreal and found myself just wondering around and enjoying the hour I was there.

memberDescription:
[u"I am an environmental consultant from New Jersey. I travel at every available opportunity, whether its a European vacation or a cross-country road trip. I'm partial to any trip that takes me to somewhere I haven't yet been, and get real pleasure from filling in another city on my TripAdvisor map when I get back!
I'm a foodie, so almost always search out local specialty food, road food, Triple Ds, and the hottest restaurants making headlines wherever I go. I'm also a beach bum, and ALWAYS pack a bathing suit, no matter where I am going.
I love to travel with friends or alone, but lately I've been doing a lot of traveling with my family, which has been really fun.
I'm perfectly happy to cram myself into the economy seat on a plane or spend my nights couchsurfing or hosteling if it means a few extra nights at my destination or a decadent splurge on a fancy dinner. Still, one day I will book a first class overseas flight and love every minute of it! "]

[u'Love travel! I live for travel, love good food, coffee, wine, cheese - love spice and mixes of great spices. Italy is a favorite but the food in France is amazing every time I go. Favorite Place: Venice IT
Second Place: Portland OR
Third Place: Paris FR ']
review: We were welcomed with free front row seats as I know the percussionist. It was an awesome show and he was a big part. After, he invited us backstage to see his drum set-up and also showed us the training/exercise room where they warm up and practice tumbling routines and dance, A fantastic evening in a beautiful 'tent'. Highly recommended.

name: Hpaterson1
CitiesVisited: Montreal, Quebec, Canada,Paris, France,
Type: Chez Chose offers a menu from a blackboard.This menu varies depending on the season and the products from our providers, each and every one of them Quebec's very own craftsmen. It also varies following the fantasies of our chef Marie-France Desrosiers whom plays around the products we receive, maintaining a fresh and seasonal selection. May it be foie gras, vegetables, rabbit, guinea fowl regardless of the delivery, she will lay in your plate a joyful mix of flavours . The perfect brew of our local farmers' hard work and the genius of Marie-France has made Chez Chose something... Grandiose. Have a taste, you will see.... Chez Chose vous propose un menu a l'ardoise. Ce menu varie au gre des saisons et des arrivages de nos fournisseurs, tous sans exception des artisans du terroir quebecois. Il varie aussi selon les fantaisies de notre chef Marie-France Desrosiers qui s'amuse avec ce que nos producteurs d'ici lui envoient, pour autant que tout soit frais et de saison.
review: Went for Mother's Day with wife/daughter (4th visit - consistently excellent). Staff do a great job of explaining their eclectic dishes/ingredients. My 14 year old ordered foie gras for her first time (and last on my tab!) and loved it. Excellent service, good wine assistance. Highly recommended - not cheap, but value for money.

review: The Renoir is expensive, but it is more than worth it, because of a creative and imaginative menu, food faultlessly cooked and presented, and service which is both efficient and friendly. It is worth every penny, and I recommend it without hesitation.

Type: Located in the heart of the Plateau for 25 years, Le Pgase is renowned for its fine French cuisine and a selection of meats cooked to perfection. You can bring your own wine, so ... be your own sommelier and select your favorite bottles!The decor and atmosphere are welcoming and friendly. A romantic evening between lovers or a convivial moment for friends conjugate there perfectly.--In the kitchenThe owner-chef Michael Audet-Lapar is illustrated in many restaurants (Chez Victoire, Le Quartier General, Laurie-Raphal, Grenadine) before investing in command of Le Pgase. Assisted by Jean-Luc Peyrotes, he applies, every day, to work fine seasonal ingredients on the well-kept cooking and to express his taste for the culinary innovation and the marriages of flavors. In the dining-roomDamien Haennel, associated owner, orchestrates the service and its rhythm with a lightness tinged with twenty years of experience in catering. A good mood and a professionalism which favors the friendly reception of our duet of waiters, Johann and Morgane.
review: ......veal chop ever, and I have eaten them all over the world. Fabulous dining experience in an intimate setting. All the courses were superb. Don't forget to try the goat cheese and veal cheek cream puffs. Thanks Damian for sharing your wonderful food with us.

Type: Chez Chose offers a menu from a blackboard.This menu varies depending on the season and the products from our providers, each and every one of them Quebec's very own craftsmen. May it be foie gras, vegetables, rabbit, guinea fowl regardless of the delivery, she will lay in your plate a joyful mix of flavours . The perfect brew of our local farmers' hard work and the genius of Marie-France has made Chez Chose something... Grandiose. Have a taste, you will see.... Chez Chose vous propose un menu a l'ardoise. Ce menu varie au gre des saisons et des arrivages de nos fournisseurs, tous sans exception des artisans du terroir quebecois. Il varie aussi selon les fantaisies de notre chef Marie-France Desrosiers qui s'amuse avec ce que nos producteurs d'ici lui envoient, pour autant que tout soit frais et de saison.
review:

Activitiy: St. Joseph's Oratory of Mount Royal, Montreal
ownerdesc: Saint Joseph's Oratory of Mount-Royal is the largest shrine dedicated to Saint Joseph in the world. You must come visit our treasures like the votive chapel containing 10,000 lights and votive candles, our marvelous museum with a permanent exhibit of hundreds of creches from around the world, the Chapel of Brother Andre built in 1904, the heart of Brother Andre, our spectacular gardens containing the Way of Cross, the Crypt Church and the majestic Basilica.
review:
A must see location perched above the city.
The cathedral is very new in terms of most cathedrals.
It felt a bit cold and sterile, but has some really good features, if a bit modern for me.
First time I have ever seen escalators in a church!
